meanings.definition: To transfer goods from one ship or mode of transportation to another.
meanings.sent1: The workers were transhipping the cargo from the large ship to the smaller boat.
meanings.sent2: The company specializes in transhipping goods between trucks and trains.
meanings.sent3: The pirates tried transhipping the treasure, but it ended up in the wrong hands!
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was transhipping her emotions from one place to another.
meanings.sent5: The efficiency of transhipping can save time and money in logistics.

meanings.definition: The act of transferring goods from one ship or mode of transportation to another.
meanings.sent1: Transhipping is a common practice in international shipping.
meanings.sent2: The transhipping of goods at the port ensures smooth distribution to various destinations.
meanings.sent3: The comedy sketch about transhipping mishaps had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent4: The transhipping of knowledge from one generation to the next is vital for progress.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of transhipping lies in its ability to streamline the supply chain.
